title: [Windows, 3.0 Preview 3.1] Making an SKGLView visible (or a grid with SKGLView visible) sometimes flashes in gray / white
body:
### Description

Sometimes on Windows, if you make an SKGLView visible, or a grid with SKGLView, visible (by changing IsVisible from false to true), the SKGLView randomly flashes in gray / white. This is probably caused by SwapChainPanel's base color being shown momentarily before the PaintSurface finishes drawing. By contrast, SKCanvasView and SKGLView on Android and iOS all work fine.

### Code

https://github.com/hyvanmielenpelit/GnollHack

On GamePage, CommandCanvas sometimes flashes if it uses SKGLView on Windows. I now changed it to use SKCanvasView on Windows.

### Expected Behavior

When made visible by changing IsVisible to true, SKGLView does not flash in gray when made visible but displays the intended graphics, as per PaintSurface.

### Actual Behavior

When changing SKGLView's IsVisible to true, SKGLView sometimes flashes gray before drawing graphics specified in PaintSurface.

### Version of SkiaSharp

3.x (Alpha)
